words.definition: If something is absurd, it is ridiculous or does not make sense.
words.example: The idea that the Earth is flat is absurd.

words.definition: Anemia is a condition in which there is a lack of red cells in the blood.
words.example: The doctor told her that she had anemia.

words.definition: The aristocracy is the highest class of people in certain societies.
words.example: The aristocracy lived in large mansions and had many servants.

words.definition: An aristocrat is a person who is a member of the aristocracy.
words.example: The aristocrat was very wealthy and powerful.

words.definition: Attire is nice or special clothing.
words.example: The guests wore formal attire to the wedding.

words.definition: A craze is something that is very popular for a short time.
words.example: The new dance was a craze among teenagers.

words.definition: To enlarge something means to make it bigger.
words.example: The company decided to enlarge its office.

words.definition: An excess is an amount of something that is more than needed.
words.example: The excess food was given to the poor.

words.definition: If something is feminine, it is related to women or girls.
words.example: The dress had a very feminine design.

words.definition: A hallmark is a typical feature of something.
words.example: The hallmark of his writing is his sense of humor.

words.definition: A pad is a thick piece of soft material used to protect or clean things.
words.example: Football players wear shoulder pads to keep them safe.

words.definition: If something is predominant, then it is the most important, common or strongest.
words.example: Before cars were invented, horses were the predominant method of travel.

words.definition: If someone or something is reputable, then they have a good reputation.
words.example: The service from the less than reputable company made her angry.

words.definition: Rouge is a red powder or cream used as makeup on the cheeks or lips.
words.example: Even when she didnâ€™t wear rouge, her cheeks appeared red.

words.definition: To signify means to be a symbol of something.
words.example: A red octagon is used to signify to stop.

words.definition: A strap is a thin long piece of fabric used to fasten or carry something.
words.example: She pulled the strap of her bag over her shoulder.

words.definition: A tangle is something that is all twisted together.
words.example: The wires were in a tangle behind the computer.

words.definition: Vanity is excessive pride in one's own appearance or achievements.
words.example: His vanity made him look at himself in the mirror all the time.

words.definition: To vie for something means to compete with others for it.
words.example: The two teams vied for the championship title.

words.definition: If something is vulgar, it is rude or lacking in style.
words.example: The comedian's vulgar jokes offended some people.
